required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Randomized, Gender Stratified, Double-Blind, Placebo- and Positive-Controlled, Three Period Crossover Trial to Assess the Effect of Guanfacine Hydrochloride on QT/QTc Interval in Healthy Men and Women

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effect of immediate-release guanfacine hydrochloride, administered at therapeutic and supratherapeutic doses, on QT/QTc in healthy normal males and females

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results (QTcNi) at Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) on Day 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Tmax (time of subject-specific maximum plasma concentration)
primary_outcome.description: QTcNi is the QT interval using a subject-specific correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate (e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results (QTcNi) at Tmax on Day 6
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Tmax (time of subject-specific maximum plasma concentration)
primary_outcome.description: QTcNi is the QT interval using a subject-specific correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate (e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results (QTcF) at Tmax on Day 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Tmax (time of subject-specific maximum plasma concentration)
primary_outcome.description: QTcF is the QT interval using Fridericia's correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate (e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results (QTcF) at Tmax on Day 6
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Tmax (time of subject-specific maximum plasma concentration)
primary_outcome.description: QTcF is the QT interval using Fridericia's correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate (e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Tmax (time of subject-specific maximum plasma concentration)

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Guanfacine and Moxifloxacin on Day 1
Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Guanfacine and Moxifloxacin on Day 6
Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Guanfacine and Moxifloxacin on Day 1
Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Guanfacine and Moxifloxacin on Day 6
Area Under the Steady-state Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) for Guanfacine and Moxifloxacin on Day 1
Area Under the Steady-state Plasma Concentration-time Curve (AUC) for Guanfacine and Moxifloxacin on Day 6

intervention.description: Subjects will receive 2x2mg immediate-release guanfacine on day 1. Subjects will receive 4x2mg immediate-release guanfacine on day 6.
Subjects will receive 400mg of moxifloxacin on day 1. Subjects will receive 400mg of moxifloxacin on day 6.
Subjects will receive placebo on Day 1. Subjects will receive placebo on Day 6.

overall_official.affiliation: Charles River Clinical Services Northwest Inc.

facility.name: Charles River Clinical Services Northwest, Inc.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This is a three period crossover trial.

group.title: Guanfacine First
group.description: Single 4 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 1, 4 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 2 and 3, 6 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 4 and 5, and a single 8 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 6 in first intervention period; single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 6 in second intervention period (after washout period); single dose of placebo on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single dose of placebo on Day 6 in third intervention period (after washout period).

group.title: Moxifloxacin First
group.description: Single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 6 in first intervention period; single dose of placebo on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single dose of placebo on Day 6 in second intervention period (after washout period); single 4 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 1, 4 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 2 and 3, 6 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 4 and 5, and a single 8 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 6 in third intervention period (after washout period).

group.title: Placebo First
group.description: Single dose of placebo on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single dose of placebo on Day 6 in first intervention period; single 4 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 1, 4 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 2 and 3, 6 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 4 and 5, and a single 8 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 6 in second intervention period (after washout period); single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 6 in third intervention period (after washout period).

group.title: Guanfacine First
group.description: Single 4 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 1, 4 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 2 and 3, 6 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 4 and 5, and a single 8 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 6 in first intervention period; single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 6 in second intervention period (after washout period); single dose of placebo on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single dose of placebo on Day 6 in third intervention period (after washout period).

group.title: Moxifloxacin First
group.description: Single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 6 in first intervention period; single dose of placebo on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single dose of placebo on Day 6 in second intervention period (after washout period); single 4 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 1, 4 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 2 and 3, 6 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 4 and 5, and a single 8 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 6 in third intervention period (after washout period).

group.title: Placebo First
group.description: Single dose of placebo on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single dose of placebo on Day 6 in first intervention period; single 4 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 1, 4 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 2 and 3, 6 mg of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl bid on Days 4 and 5, and a single 8 mg dose of immediate-release Guanfacine HCl on Day 6 in second intervention period (after washout period); single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 1, placebo bid on Days 2, 3, 4, and 5, and single 400 mg dose of Moxifloxacin on Day 6 in third intervention period (after washout period).

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results (QTcNi) at Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) on Day 1
outcome.description: QTcNi is the QT interval using a subject-specific correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate (e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Tmax (time of subject-specific maximum plasma concentration)
outcome.population: Pharmacodynamic (PD) population consists of all evaluable subjects with no major protocol deviations. "Evaluable" subjects were defined as subjects who received a Day 6 dose and had Day 6 data for the primary and secondary endpoints for all three periods.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Results (QTcNi) at Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) on Day 1
measure.description: QTcNi is the QT interval using a subject-specific correction formula. QT interval is a measure of time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave and is dependent on the heart rate (e.g., the faster the heart rate, the shorter the QT interval). The QT interval has to be corrected in order to aid interpretation.
measure.population: Pharmacodynamic (PD) population consists of all evaluable subjects with no major protocol deviations. "Evaluable" subjects were defined as subjects who received a Day 6 dose and had Day 6 data for the primary and secondary endpoints for all three periods.

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Guanfacine and Moxifloxacin on Day 1
outcome.population: Pharmacokinetic (PK) population consists of all subjects in the safety population (subjects who had taken one dose of study medication and had one follow-up safety assessment completed) who had evaluable concentration-time profiles.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually
